template.line_2_html: I've just started using Hnry (who sort all my taxes for me), which means I need you to update my payment info on your end.

card.body: Auto-top-up my Hnry Card so I can purchase expenses on the go.
card.body_updated: Automatically add funds to my Hnry Account so I can purchase expenses on the go.

custom.body: Start from scratch, donate to charity or pay to friends or family.

pension.body: Send funds into my Pension every time I get paid.

sick_leave.body: Everyone gets sick, but donâ€™t get caught out by unexpected bills whilst you are not earning. Set up your rainy-day fund.

index.empty_state_subheading: Allocate a portion of your income to a charity, savings accounts, investments and more!

overview_banner.body: Take the reins of your financial journey by allocating a percentage of your income to an account of your choosing every time you get paid. Whether it's boosting your Pension, building your savings, fuelling your investment dreams, or supporting a charity close to your heart.
overview_banner.heading: Save like a pro with Allocations

select_template.default_caption: Create an Allocation to any local Bank Account, or select from one of our preset Allocations from our list below.
select_template.uplift_caption: Select from one of our preset Allocations from our list below.

errors.zero_rated_or_directors_drawings: Client cannot be VAT-free and pay director's drawings

form.has_prior_deduction_percentage_tooltip: Some Clients may be required to deduct part of your Income Tax before paying you. This is called 'Tax deducted at source'.
form.international_client_warning_html: International payments need to be paid directly to your personal account or via a payment platform (eg. Wise) before coming through to the Hnry account. See more here, or get in touch with us via the â€˜Helpâ€™ button.

false.label: This Client is outside the United Kingdom

true.label: This Client is outside the United Kingdom or Services for this Client are exempt from VAT

invalid_messages.greater_than: Tax percentage must be less than or equal to 45%
invalid_messages.less_than: Tax percentage must be greater than or equal to 9.9%

prior_deductions.percentage_label: Percentage of tax deducted by client
prior_deductions.variable_alert_text: If your Client deducts expenses prior to payment, you will need to send us your payment remittance to support@hnry.co.uk before your payment can be processed.

form.sales_tax_settings_warning_html:
By turning on this toggle, VAT will not be charged for services done for this client. Only certain services are exempt from VAT. You will be liable if VAT shouldâ€™ve been charged.

If your client is outside of the United Kingdom, please read our International payments guide. If you have any questions get in touch with our team.

tooltip.text: Your client deducts and pays a percentage of your self-employed income tax to the HMRC before paying you

index.tooltip: If you're working for a recruiter or company that deducts tax at source, you'll need to make sure you add them as a client.

form.client_reimbursement_notice_html: Client Reimbursements cannot also be raised as a Business Expense.
form.mileage_eoyf_text: HMRC rules specify you can only claim either Mileage or Motor Vehicle Expenses - but not both. By creating a Motor Vehicle or Mileage Expense, you will only be able to use this category for the remainder of the financial year, and will be unable to switch.
form.mileage_text: HMRC rules specify you can only claim either Mileage or Motor Vehicle Expenses - but not both. By creating a Motor Vehicle or Mileage Expense, you will only be able to use this category for the remainder of the financial year, and will be unable to switch.
form.motor_vehicle_text: HMRC rules specify you can only claim either Mileage or Motor Vehicle Expenses - but not both. By creating a Motor Vehicle or Mileage Expense, you will only be able to use this category for the remainder of the financial year, and will be unable to switch.

rejection_accept_modal.reject_acceptance_terms: I accept full liability for this expense and wish to claim it against Hnry and HMRC guidelines
rejection_accept_modal.warning_text: This expense has been declined as it is not claimable according to HMRC policy. By resubmitting this expense, you are accepting full liability and, in the even of an HMRC audit, you will be required to provide proof of the validity of this claim.

expense_table.claimable_amount_info: The claimable amount is calculated from information you have provided e.g. the size of your home office, and/or percentage of business usage, or an asset depreciation which may span several years. If you are VAT registered this will be the VAT exclusive amount.

index.empty_state_subheading: Add your other sources of income to make sure that your tax rate is correct.

num_1.text: Deducting a business expense reduces the amount of your income you are required to pay tax on.
num_1.title: How do business expenses work?

num_2.text: What can you claim, and how do you raise a Business Expense in Hnry?
num_2.title: What can I claim as a business expense?

num_3.title: How to provide us with Business Expenses incurred prior to joining Hnry

num_4.text: Raising Invoices through Hnry is easy and can all be done in a few short steps.

enter_unique_taxpayer_reference.feedback_no: Until you enter your Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR), you wonâ€™t be able to access the full Hnry service as we need your UTR in order to act as your accountant and automatically pay your tax. To receive a UTR, youâ€™ll need to register for Self Assessment with HMRC. It can take up to 15 days for your UTR to arrive, so make sure to register if you havenâ€™t already.
enter_unique_taxpayer_reference.feedback_yes: Until you enter your Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR), you wonâ€™t be able to access the full Hnry service as we need your UTR in order to act as your accountant and automatically pay your tax. Your UTR can be found in your Personal Tax Account, or on a previous tax return.
enter_unique_taxpayer_reference.title: Your account is missing important information

index.business_expenses_savings: Business Expenses work to reduce the amount of Income Tax (and VAT) you need to pay. Make sure to raise your Business Expenses using the correct categories and we will calculate the Claimable Amount for you.

client_payment_modal.success_alert: Your payment should arrive in your personal bank account within the next few minutes, depending on bank processing times.

multiple_clients_modal.disclaimer: Please note that you only need to assign a payment to multiple clients if some have VAT or withholding tax included, and others do not.
multiple_clients_modal.instruction: To make sure this payment is processed correctly, please include each client's name and the amount they paid.

show.edenred_blurb: Edenred is our payment partner. You may see their name when making a payment.

has_salary_income.tooltip: Salary/PAYE Income has Income Tax deductions and include entitlements to Annual Leave and Sick Leave provided by your employer.

has_self_employed_income.tooltip: Self-employed refers to anyone who conducts business activity on their own.

sales_tax_exempt.tooltip_html:
VAT will be set to 0% for zero-rated Clients.

Clients should be zero-rated if you are in Great Britain and they do not trade in the UK. Or you are in Northern Ireland and they do not trade in the UK and EU, or they are VAT registered in EU

index.intro_html:
Use this section to tell us about any expenses you have from prior to joining us (excluding any expenses you have already uploaded to Hnry).

You should enter the total amount for each Expense category per month.

N.B. Given that Hnry will not be reviewing receipts for these expenses, we are unable to warrant the validity of Expenses raised in this section. You will need to ensure you hold onto the receipts for 5 years should HMRC ever require them. If you would like us to review and approve any expenses then you should raise these in the system as individual claims instead.

If you're not sure what is claimable, check our Guide to Claiming Business Expenses.
index.title: Pre-Hnry Expenses

invite_friends.paragraph_1: For every person who joins Hnry using your promo code, you'll both get Â£15 credit on your Hnry account when they start using the service. ðŸŽ‰

sales_tax_registered.label: I am currently registered for VAT as an individual

locked.content: If you need to change your VAT Status please get in touch with the Hnry team.

not_locked.content: If you earn more than Â£90,000/year of self-employed income, you must be registered for Value Added Tax (VAT) as per HMRC's legislation.

locked.content: If you no longer have a Student Loan then you need to get in contact with the Hnry team.

not_locked.content: If you have a student loan we may need to deduct additional tax amounts to cover Student Loan repayments.

tax_id_number.label: My NI number
tax_id_number.title: must be digits and letters with optional spaces or dashes

tooltip.disabled: If you need to change your NI number please get in touch with the Hnry team.

unique_taxpayer_reference.label: My UTR
unique_taxpayer_reference.title: UTR format is 10 or 13 digits e.g. 1234567890
unique_taxpayer_reference.tooltip:
As a sole trader, you are required to have a Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR). If you donâ€™t have a UTR, youâ€™ll need to register for Self Assessment with HMRC

tooltip.disabled: If you need to change your VAT number please get in touch with the Hnry team.

gst_registered_warning_modal.add_services_paragraph: Any Services you have already created will default to VAT exclusive. You can update your prices to be VAT inclusive in your Services.
gst_registered_warning_modal.tell_clients_and_recruiters: If you do not send invoices, then you must ensure you let your Client or Recruiter know that you are VAT Registered.
gst_registered_warning_modal.title: VAT Registration

intro.intro_p1: Use the sections below to tell us about your financial information. We need to know your tax details like your NI Number and VAT registration, as well as the Bank Account you would like to be paid into.

invoice_quote_financial_field_modal.input_pattern_title: must be 9-digits, (sometimes with "GB" at the start) and can be found on your VAT registration certificate
invoice_quote_financial_field_modal.label: My VAT number
invoice_quote_financial_field_modal.label_tooltip: VAT number must be 9-digits, (sometimes with "GB" at the start) and can be found on your VAT registration certificate.
invoice_quote_financial_field_modal.paragraph_clients: Since you are VAT registered we need to know your VAT number before you can create an Invoice.
invoice_quote_financial_field_modal.paragraph_invoices: Since you are VAT registered we need to know your VAT number before you can create an Invoice.
invoice_quote_financial_field_modal.paragraph_quotes: Since you are VAT registered we need to know your VAT number before you can create a Quote.
invoice_quote_financial_field_modal.title: VAT number
